articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mongolia 
   Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Some Tasks of Ideological Education of the Party" was brought out in pamphlet by a Mongolian publishing house on Sept. 4.
 The work, published on Jan. 11, Juche 79 (1990), clarifies directions and ways of intensifying education to give clear understanding of the advantages of the socialist system of the DPRK, education in Korean-nation-first spirit, education in revolutionary traditions, class education and the ideological education of the Party as required by the developing reality.

articles.title: Repeal of "Security Law" Demanded in S. Korea
U.S. Urged to Implement Sept. 19 Joint Statement
articles.content:
Repeal of "Security Law" Demanded in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the "Joint Measure Committee for Abolishing the Security Law, Defending the Liberty of Scholarship and Opposing Suppression of Professor Kang Jong Gu" and the Students Committee of the Democratic Workers' Party on Sept. 7 called a joint press conference in front of the Seoul District Public Prosecutor's Office in demand of the repeal of the "security law," according to a media report.
 At the press conference, the organizations denounced the security authorities for filing a lawsuit without detention against Ri Ju Hui, chairperson of the Students Committee of the Democratic Workers' Party, and arresting Choe Hui Jong (pen name Kim Son Ju), permanent research member of the "south Korean Institute of Civil Rights", on charges of the violation of the notorious "security law" and resorting to harsher crackdown on Prof. Kang Jong Gu of Dongguk University and the Pusan branch of the "National Teachers Union."    
 Branding the repression by the security authorities as an act for helping the pro-U.S. conservative forces create a phase for grabbing power, they declared they would fight till the "security law" is totally abolished.

articles.title: Sixth National Sports Meet of Agricultural Workers Closes
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Implement Sept. 19 Joint Statement 
   Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity of south Korea to Implement the June 15 Joint Declaration reportedly made public a statement on Sept. 7 urging the U.S. to properly understand the will of the Korean nation for peaceful reunification, immediately stop the moves for a war against the north and opt for implementing the Sept. 19 joint statement.
 It noted that the U.S., talking about "dialogue and peace", conducted a north-targeted provocative interceptor missile test-fire on Sept. 1 after staging military exercises for a preemptive attack on the north including the recent "Ulji Focus Lens" joint military exercises of bellicose nature. This clearly indicates who is chiefly to blame for threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula, the statement added, and continued:    
 We will not remain passive onlookers to the U.S. acts of threatening peace on this land with dangerous provocations for a war against the north in violation of the spirit of the September 19 joint statement calling for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula agreed upon at the fourth six-party talks.

Gifts to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by the director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and the secretary general of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea and their parties on visits to the DPRK.
 They were separately handed over to officials concerned by General Director Edmond Jouve and Secretary General Alva Chavez.    
 Meanwhile, a gift to Kim Jong Il from the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism was conveyed to an official concerned.

Protocol on Cooperation between DPRK and Mongolian Foreign Ministries
   Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- A protocol on cooperation between the foreign ministries of the DPRK and Mongolia was signed here Tuesday.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Il, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and from the opposite side were members of the delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia headed by S. Khurelbaatar and Mongolian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Janchivdorjyn Lomvo.    
 The protocol was inked by Kim Yong Il and the ambassador.

articles.title: "Russian Spirit" Orchestra Here
articles.content:
DPRK Young Football Team Qualified for U-17 World Championship
   Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK young football team defeated Chinese team 2:1 in the quarter finals to advance to the semi-finals of the U-17 Asian Championship now under way in Singapore since Sept. 3. The DPRK team was thus qualified to participate in the U-17 World Championship to be held in south Korea next year.
 The DPRK team will face the Tajik team in the semi-finals on Sept. 14.
